      • coeffRadialZCumSumLog

        public static double[] coeffRadialZCumSumLog(int n,
                                             int m)
        Compute the coefficient of the radial Zernike polynomial

        Compute a Zernike polynomial of size Height rows and Width columns of degree J over the radius of the pupil. (-1)^k (n-k)! r^{n-2*k} R^m_n(r) = sum_{k=0}^{(n-m)/2} ---------------------------- k! ((n+m)/2-k)! ((n-m)/2-k)!

        Utilisation du logarithme de la somme cumulé

        k = mod number of the Zernike polynomials (Noll indexing)

        Parameters:
        n -
        m -
        Returns:
        R_mn radial coef

      • radialZDegree

        public static double[] radialZDegree(int n,
                                     int m)

      • zernikeArray

        public static double[] zernikeArray(int nbZernike,
                                    int width,
                                    int height,
                                    double radius,
                                    boolean normalize,
                                    boolean radial)
        Create Nzern Zernike polynomials over a radius Pre-compute the power distance r, r^2 = r*r, r^3=r^2*r, ect. Z_even(r,theta) = R_mn*zr*cos(m*theta) Z_odd(r,theta) = R_mn*zr*sin(m*theta) Zr(r) =
        Parameters:
        nbZernike - - number of zernike modes
        width - - width of the array
        height - - width of the array
        radius - - radius of the pupil
        normalize - - when true all polynomial a L2 normalized
        radial - - when true only radial polynomial are considered (m =0)
        Returns:
        array of Zernike polynomials
